decision_conditions: The proposed alterations to the host application (P1232.14) would - through inappropriate material choice - fail to integrate well into the existing site and the area more generally, and would be unacceptable when assessed against policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 (MALP), draft London Plan policy D4, and policies CP17 and DC61 of the Havering Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, and that no alternative designs could reasonably be achieved, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent prior to the issue of the decision notice.
description:
Variation of conditions No.2 (materials to be approved by council prior to works commencing)  and No.3 (development shall be built in accordance with approved plans) of planning application P1232.14 dated 04/11/2014 (Two storey side and rear extension to existing dwelling with new roof and dormers to front and rear). Variations sought:
- to permit the materials used to be retrospectively approved and the addition of a roof lantern to the kitchen extension.
